title: Junior Producer - Philippines
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
A Jr. Producer is the Agency’s go-to person when it comes to identifying the best partners and suppliers to make ideas for Video, Radio, Print and Innovation come to life. This role is critical in the success of the Agency because a Jr. Producer will help dictate the kind of work and output that the group will be known for.
What You’ll Do 

Production Requirements 85%

Agile enough to work with specific teams and brands for various production jobs
Takes the lead in all client presentations from the Pre-production stage to the final presentation of the material
Works closely with:

The Creative and Production teams (Video, Print, Radio and Innovation) to ensure the best output for the given idea
The Accounts and Finance teams to ensure that all costs are within budget






Agency Initiatives 10%

Works to achieve the Awards KPIs of the whole Agency by providing the best support for any awards-driven idea
Coordinates with Regional counterparts and offices with various expertise to ensure the best kind of output 




Clout Development 5%

Provides monthly updates on new and exciting suppliers that the Agency can tap for future projects
Keeps all current partnerships and reels up to date for quick access of the entire group



What You’ll Need  

He / she should have a good understanding of ATL, BTL and digital shoot and recording requirements.
He / she must have enough clout in the industry to forge strong working relationships with suppliers and teams within the agency.
He / she should be able to multitask various projects and brands and still maintain high quality output.
He / she should have a strong grasp and understanding of financials per project and must be able to work within given budgets.

How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
